questions.question: I like …………………… music.
questions.description: We cannot use every with uncountable nouns.

questions.question: You have eaten ……………………… loaf.
questions.description: All is not normally used with a or an.

questions.question: Under no circumstances ………………………… allowed in the pub.
questions.description: We use an inverted word order after negative expressions like ‘under no circumstances’.

questions.question: The two sisters are very much ……………………….
questions.description: Alike means like each other. It is used in predicative positions.

questions.question: I was here a year ………………………….
questions.description: We use ago to count back from the present.

questions.question: ………………………… drug is 100 percent safe.
questions.description: We cannot start a new sentence with not any. Instead we use no.

questions.question: I think we should paint the wall …………………….. color.
I am looking forward to being .................................
He has two children. …………………… of them are good at maths.
questions.description: Both is used to speak of two people or things.

questions.question: I will be here ……………………. four o’clock onwards.
questions.description: We do not use since to measure duration from the point of view of a future end-point.

questions.question: I will phone you when I …………………….. time.
questions.description: In subordinate clauses, we normally use a present tense with a future meaning.

questions.question: I had no sooner closed the door …………………….. somebody knocked.
